item.description:
Join fellow member Tomn aka Tony Maiella at Johnny D's for his CD release party on Friday August 27th. His Brazilian influenced style is quite impressive.

This will be an AMAZING PARTY with the addition of the lively powerful sound from Marcus Santos and Bloco AfroBrazil. Here's yet another chance for you to experience the baddest, loudest, funnest indoor carnival sound around. Yes, I am a GIGANTIC fan which is apparent because each time this group parties, I add them to the calendar because they exceed expectation. The Boston Happy Hour, Dining, and Traveling Meetup groups are invited to join the party to make it an even merrier time. Let's pack the place again, because the more the merrier and also your presence will convince Johnny D's to keep the Bloco AfroBrazil party on their schedule.

Local band Ray Hendricks Revival is also performing original music, which sounds real cool

Bring your friends....I guarantee a funtastic time, that is if you like your music strong and your party loud.

You must be at least 21 but you don't have to drink, just enjoy each others company and an AMAZING! show.

Once the drumming, singing and dancing start, group conversation is difficult. Let's just enjoy the party!


$10 cash cover charge at the door
If you want to be included in the 8:30 PM dinner reservation you must also order at least $10 (this is in addition to $10 cover) in food and/or drink....otherwise you're welcome to enjoy the show from the bar or dance floor.


If you come for just the music, stop by the dinner table to say hello and so you can meet folks.


Johnny D's Dinner Menu



PLEASE MAINTAIN YOUR OWN TAB OR PAY AS YOU ORDER - THANK YOU


DIRECTIONS:

Map of Nearby Municiple Parking Lots
WARNING------SOME METERS ARE OPERATIONAL UNTIL 10 PM------WARNING

From Cambridge (Harvard Square):
From Harvard Square travel north on Massachusetts Avenue and pass the porter Square T-Station and the Porter Square Shopping Center on the right. From Porter Square, continue on Massachusetts Avenue through seven traffic lights; at the seventh light turn right onto Cameron Avenue. At end of Cameron turn right onto Holland Street. 5 streets down on the right hand side, turn onto Buena Vista Road. Parking is available in the metered municipal (city) lot which is immediately on your left and in other lots nearby.

From the West (Route 2 or Route 16 Watertown):
Head west on Route 16 past the Alewife T-Station and continue to the intersection of Massachusetts. Turn right onto Massachusetts Avenue. At the third set of traffic lights, take a left onto Cameron Avenue. *Follow Cameron Avenue directions below. At end of Cameron turn right onto Holland Street. 5 streets down on the right hand side, turn onto Buena Vista Road. Parking is available in the metered municipal (city) lot which is immediately on your left and in other lots nearby.

From the North (traveling South on Interstate 93):
Take Exit 32 (Route 60, Medford Square). Bear right at end of ramp proceeding through Medford Square and follow signs to Route 16 West. Follow Route 16 (for approximately 2 miles from the Route 93 exits) until you reach the intersection of Route 16 and Broadway (Somerville). Turn left onto Broadway. At the second set of traffic lights (Teele Square), bear right onto Holland Street. Parking is available in the metered municipal (city) lot which is immediately on your left and in other lots nearby.

From the South (traveling North on Interstate 93):
Take Exit 31 (Route 16 West/Mystic Valley Pkwy). Follow Route 16 (for approximately 2 miles from the Route 93 exits) until you reach the intersection of Route 16 and Broadway (Somerville). Turn left onto Broadway. At the second set of traffic lights (Teele Square), bear right onto Holland Street. Parking is available in the metered municipal (city) lot which is immediately on your left and in other lots nearby.

From the East:
Travel on Route 16 West (Revere Beach Pkwy ? Mystic Valley Pkwy ? Alewife Brook Pkwy). Follow Route 16 (for approximately 2 miles from the Route 93 exits) until you reach the intersection of Route 16 and Broadway (Somerville). Turn left onto Broadway. At the second set of traffic lights (Teele Square), bear right onto Holland Street. Parking is available in the metered municipal (city) lot which is immediately on your left and in other lots nearby.

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:

Create your route at http://mbta.com/... or http://www.hopstop.co...

Subway - Red line to Davis station and exit from the Holland Street side (just turn right after you've exited the turnstiles). Johnny D's is directly across the street as you exit the station.

Bus - Routes: 87, 88, 90, 94 and 96
item.how_to_find_us: Details will be emailed to all those who've RSVPd YES & MAYBE

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: CD Release Party at Johnny D's Friday August 27th 8:30PM
